Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0641 b) Date of Occurrence: 27/08/2024
c) Installation Details: Vulture Heavy - AC-5966-938 at
Sector West Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Electrical b) Date Component 31/08/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Emergency Power d) Main Assembly: Pylon-D
e) Nomenclature: Emergency Power Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-D
g) Part No.: EL-5695-B4 h) Sl No.: SN-9884-150
i) Firmware Version: FW-6.3.137 j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 26/08/2022 l) Date of Removal: 30/08/2024
Pg No: 76 Ln No: 2 Pg No: 106 Ln No: 17
m) Manufacturing Agency: Summit Defense Solutions n) Date, Month & Year September 2020
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 1970 Hrs / 1993 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Wiring harness insulation breakdown. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Emergency Power component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
Date: 22/09/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 24/09/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 24/09/2024 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 29/09/2024 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable.
Date: 02/10/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
